content: So true, who you are and your ‘passion’ is all about where you actually put your energy and attention into. When I was much younger and still trying to figure out “what I wanna be when I grow up”, happened to take some career counseling and aptitude tests. One of the tests featured a series of bar graphs divided into different areas of life, that measured where I currently invested my energies, compared to most other folks around my age. It included areas like ‘business’, ‘politics’, etc., and my results showed a ‘yooge’ spike in one area generally called “aesthetics”, which included everything from music and poetry to the visual arts. And when I looked around in my life, sure enuff without even being aware of it, the Arts and Design were heavily influencing most of my attention, from what I bought and read, to even decorating my house (hey, young guys gotta have a ‘cool pad’ to ‘get the chicks’…lol)! But long story short, that one ‘visualization’ immediately put me on the path to my future ‘calling’ as a Commercial Artist and Designer. And looking back now from the ‘wisdom’ of retirement, it proved to be the best decision I ever made.
